page.title: 15RURAL OCKBROOK
page.content: {FOOTPATHS:}Footpaths in the village are used regularly by walkers and riders.Many Elms,dead from Dutch Elm disease,can be seen.One large field full of wheat (because of E.E.C. subsidy)was previously five different fields.Evidence can be seen of{hedges {lost}as a result.{Hawthorn hedge} formed the boundary,nettles,dogrose and elderberry.The bright yellow of { {Oil Seed Rape}growing in one field is a common sight in the English countryside today due to the increased use of vegetable oil as opposed to animal fat in today's diet. Some fields are given over to {Barley}for animal feed.An electricity pylon can be seen in one field and many {power {lines}are visible across the sky.In the angle of Victoria Ave. and A52 by-pass are some boarding kennels for dogs.{P.19 All Saint's Church Ockbrook
